body.name: A Wallflower for the Stoic Duke: A Historical Regency Romance Novel
body.description: In the stifling confines of her own home, Lady Anna Stuart, an unconventional and intelligent young lady, finds solace in her love for botany and the secret world of plant medicine. Trapped for a fourth year in the marriage market by her cruel brother and scheming aunt, Anna has resigned herself to the fate of an old maid. However, a chance encounter with the older yet intriguing Duke of Manchester offers her a glimmer not only of hope, but also true romanceâ€¦Will her blossoming connection with the enigmatic Duke be the key to unlocking her heart's desires or merely another thorn in the intricate bouquet of societal expectations?Lord Maximilian Montagu, Duke of Manchester, has long avoided the ton after the devastating loss of his beloved wife and unborn child. Lonely and yearning for companionship, he returns to society with the intention of merely fulfilling his duty to remarry and secure an heir. When he meets the captivating Lady Anna Stuart though, a profound spark ignites within him, challenging his resolve to keep his heart closed.Can he battle his own demons and explore the possibility of finding an even greater love?Together, they embark on a charade orchestrated by Maximilian to free Anna from the clutches of her conniving aunt. As they dance through society, their connection deepens, and the whispers of scandal surround them. Both haunted by their pasts, they must navigate the treacherous waters of societal expectations, family dynamics, and the undeniable longing that grows between them. Will their ruse lead to liberation or entangle them further in a web of deceit, jeopardizing their chance at true love?"A Wallflower for the Stoic Duke" is a historical romance novel of approximately 80,000 words. No cheating, no cliffhangers, and a guaranteed happily ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Annabella and Maximilian
reviews.reviewText: This historical romance revolves around Anna and Max, a sheltered lady seeking a fourth year for a marriage match and Max, a widower returning after a five year hiatus from England, and their complicated romance. The drama to the story was caused by Anna’s brother who belittled Anna every day, and their aunt, a manipulative, vile person solely working for her own personal goals. Teamed together, Anna had to endure a horrible life. The author did a great job in clearly defining how despicable these two characters were to Anna, allowing the reader to truly feel empathy for her. I enjoyed the author’s creative ways she incorporated a ruse, and manipulative ploys to cause havoc for the couple keeping the reader engaged, and interested in the couple’s outcome. The final chapters of the story reinforces the belief that justice will always prevail, as will love. Great story. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the clean romance. The only major flaw I remember was the age of the heroine was stated as 20 and 18, with 4 seasons behind her the 18 was very unrealistic. Even the twenty meant that she came out at 16. The heroine was very much downtrodden by her aunt and brother. The widow hero at age 32 feels old mostly due to his grief and life experiences. They meet in a garden and there is an attraction, but the hero feels he can only help her find happiness with another man. There is a lot of manipulation happening, but finally the brother comes around and helps his sister. I liked that the heroine was a healer and an artist. It was too bad that she had to hide those skills. The extended epilogue wasn’t attached to the book, which I don’t like. The author really made you feel for the heroine and wanting to shake some sense into the hero.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great storyline
reviews.reviewText: This was a story of a sweet young woman that has a cruel brother and scheming aunt. They have plans for her with no feelings about what she feels! But fate has other ideas for this young woman as she meets someone that will change her life! I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice clean storyline with a wonderful ending
reviews.reviewText: Max and Anna were a perfect match the minute they met. He thought he was too old for her at age 32 to her age 20. The storyline lingered too much on his doubts as well as her cruel aunt. Finally Anna's brother came to a realization and his plan was perfect for all, quite dramatic. Perfect epilogue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Well written, full of love, drama, emotions, romance, marriage of convenience, society, power struggles and history. This author is able to take you to that time period with story telling ability. Anna has had 4 seasons and according to her family , will need to marry soon. Max is a Duke but has some issues he still needs to work on. His past still is so heavy in his heart. He offers Anna a plan so that she can get away from her family and him to have someone to be with. Together they can find happiness and love. Lots of work for them to get there. Would recommend to others.I am an ARC and leave this unbiased, honest review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Alice Kirks title
reviews.reviewText: A lady looking for marriage with a toxic family and a duke coming home from abroad are the main characters in this Alice Kirks page turning regency romance. I enjoyed this tale a lot as I always do with this author. It's a wonderful read and as always with Alice Kirks titles I was very glad to have read it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A Wallflower for the Stoic duke
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely loved that Anna worked with plants and healed other people with her knowledge. I was delighted that Max built Anna a greenhouse!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I loved the story and the characters. I agree with some other reviewers that the use of some modern terms had me shaking my head and rereading some passages. Otherwise, the book was good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a story to read and enjoy. The characters are interesting, be they good or unpleasant and even the lesser characters have a life to them that draws you in. Then down sides are few, mainly too much bile in the throat too often and a missed edit concerning the main character’s age. I am not fond of extended epilogues as I feel they should be included in the book and not used as a means of getting you to be part of the author’s community. However I realise this is used by many authors. So I liked the additional final chapter although I felt the aunt’s complete change of personae a little too sudden to be believable. So overall a great story and worth reading, enjoy.I love being an ARC reader!
Highly recommend this book by a great author

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Alice is a wonderfully descriptive writer another story that pulls on your heartstrings as the duke battles his feelings, whether he is ready for a relationship. A beautiful story well written for lovers of historical romance.

This book is quite different from the usual run of the mill Regency Romance. The Wallflower, Lady Anna Stuart, in downtrodden by he brother & Aunt, but her exterior facade doesn't match her well developed sense of her self & her skills. She meets & falls for Max Montagu, Duke of Manchester & widower of 5 years at a Ball where he returns to dip his toe into the Marriage Mart, needing to move on with his life. He doesn't expect to find love again, being 12 years older than Lady Anna, he proposes a fake courtship to help her find a husband.....Anna wants it to be him! It was nice to read Anna stand up for herself & her passions, including speaking forthrightly that she wants Max to be her spouse, not who her aunt, brother or Max try to convince her is best.
